text:
From a convo with <@UM4EYDDAS> it would be really cool to be able to "View Dependents" on HubSpots default modules like seeing all the templates/pages where the flexible column module is used. Convo Here:
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CFPRTEGTX/p1565369214012700>
+1 for this as well as smart forms

Does anyone know if "enabling multiple templates for subscription pages" is a feature that is coming to HubSpot anytime soon?  I found this article but there has been no activity since 2018.  Is there a workaround for this feature?
 <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Enable-to-use-multiple-template-for-subscription-pages/idi-p/7767>
Are you refering to the HubSpot generated ones?
You can create a custom form and use workflows to do that the subscriptions pages do

Give us built-in templates and tools for developing our own design system that's fully integrated into our themes. Use Canvas as the template (<https://canvas.HubSpot.com/>)

This is a long shot lol

IDEA: Automatically create a redirect when a page is archived after being updated in content staging.

When a page is updated using Content Staging, the old version of the page is archived and given a new url, but there is no redirect created for that archived url to the original url.  This, in turn, will cause any links created with a page selector in a custom module to break after the page has been updated in Content Staging.  Broken links are always bad news, and it's pretty frustrating that two HS tools don't work together.
Hey <@U54TVT3C1>, this sounds like a bug. Could you point me to a page of yours where the links for the page selector haven't updated?
